Q: How do "motion to dismiss" and "motion for summary judgment" differ in legal proceedings?
correct_answer: Q: What is "voir dire" and why is it conducted in court proceedings?
wrong_answers: Q: Define "nunc pro tunc" and describe its typical use in legal contexts.
Q: What is the "fruit of the poisonous tree" doctrine in criminal law?
Q: Explain the difference between "de novo" and "abuse of discretion" standards of review.
